channel.title: Java error!
channel.description:
every now and again my minecraft will close itself and then i'll find a notepad document saying "hs_err_pid####" this is the beggining snippet, i'd post more but i dont know what parts are sensitive- # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x690d9464, pid=6104, tid=5828 # # JRE version: 6.0_29-b11 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (20.4-b02 mixed mode windows-x86 ) # Problematic frame: # C [atioglxx.dll+0xd9464] # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code. # See problematic frame for where to report the bug. #
-there is three sections after that "-----thread------","-----process------", and "------system-------" this happened about 7 times, so i have 7 notepads saying about this, this is the latest one above

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

triston001:

[quote author= output]invalid or corrupt jar file minecraft.jar[/quote] what now?

Uuhhgg… You have the windows launcher, grab the Linux version. Don’t worry, it will work fine.
Here

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“triston001, post:12, topic:433659”]im sry, im still confused where to put the thing at
so inside the file “minecraft.jar” inside bin, i run the program, or next the minecraft launcher ( i tried and i only heard an error noise as it flashed open and flashed close imediatly)[/quote]
Next to the launcher. If you herd an error noise, try this and post the output. It won’t close, and will give you time to get the error.

@echo off
title Minecraft
java -Xmx1532m -Xms1532m -jar minecraft.jar
pause

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

triston001:

inside the bin and reboot the minecraft game?

No, this goes in the same place as your launcher (if using a JAR format launcher). It will launch the minecraft launcher giving it 1.5GB of RAM usage, instead of 1GB. The launcher will pass this onto minecraft itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

so i just write the batch file saying that text inside the bin and reboot the minecraft game?

im still new to MS-DOS so can u give me the text to write in creating the batch file?

nvm, i think i figured out how with notepad

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

If you don’t have enough VM set away for it, you will get

Error occurred during initialization of VM
Could not reserve enough space for object heap

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I made a batch file in the same place as the launcher (named minecraft.jar) and just ran it. Here is the text in it.

@echo off
title Minecraft
start javaw -Xmx1532m -Xms1532m -jar minecraft.jar
exit

The window will close, while minecraft will still run normally.

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!

item.description:

oh, thanks coony-kun! now how do i do that

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I had these after minecraft crash’s. Its simply a crash report to tell you what happened. I solved my issue by allocating 1.5GB to the JVM for minecraft instead of default 1GB.

Read full topic

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001

is that it, i found it under the label ----system-----

item.title: Java error!
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

every now and again my minecraft will close itself and then i’ll find a notepad document saying “hs_err_pid####”
this is the beggining snippet, i’d post more but i dont know what parts are sensitive-

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x690d9464, pid=6104, tid=5828

JRE version: 6.0_29-b11

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ Client VM (20.4-b02 mixed mode windows-x86 )

Problematic frame:

C [atioglxx.dll+0xd9464]

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code.

See problematic frame for where to report the bug.

-there is three sections after that “-----thread------”,"-----process------", and “------system-------”
this happened about 7 times, so i have 7 notepads saying about this, this is the latest one above
